channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2023080800
item.description:
Report X-2023080800

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: SEQUENCE OF EVENTS IS UNKNOWN. DescribePack: THIS PACKAGE CONTAINED 4 GLASS CONTAINERS OF ACETONE. UNFORTUNATELY, THIS PACKAGE BECAME DAMAGED AT SOME POINT. ONE OF THE CONTAINERS HAS SHATTERED. AS A RESULT, THE CONTENTS HAVE COMPLETELY LEAKED OUT. THE PACKAGE MAY HAVE BEEN DROPPED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED IN OUR DAMAGED HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023080707
item.description:
Report X-2023080707

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was coming down the NC line and as the package handler pulled it off the belt to place onto a cart they noticed it leaking at the bottom. They informed their manager whom placed the container into a hazmat bin so it could be transported to the hazmat cage, where it was inspected by the hazmat team and placed into a yellow hazmat drum under ventilation. DescribePack: at the bottom of the near corner of the container there is a small slit that is leaking DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a lined hazmat bin and brought to the hazmat cage where it was inspected and placed in a yellow hazmat drum under ventilation then sealed.

item.title: Report X-2023080696
item.description:
Report X-2023080696

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was found on the 400 side being pinned up against other IC's. It was wet on the top and I took it down to our hazmat cage and put it on the fumes hud with the fan on. DescribePack: 4 cans were bent and dented with one having a hole in it and it was leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I brought it down to the hazmat cage and put it on the fumes hud with the fan on.

item.title: Report E-2023080904
item.description:
Report E-2023080904

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case and that of the inner metal one gallon can of paint (un1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023080575
item.description:
Report E-2023080575

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into 3 of the metal 5 gallon cans of paint (un1263) releasing 8 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
